metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18227 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.3 and 2.4.0 to 2.4.9, the MS-WSP protocoldissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-mswsp.cby properly handling NULL return values.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18227` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.4-2~ubuntu14.04.1').
